title: Suzuki Vitara IG advertisement
description: Instagram advertisement created in the class 'GRDE 129: Introduction to Graphic Design' displaying the Suzuki Vitara, by utilizing the software Adobe Illustrator and tools such as scaling, cropping for getting the best-suited image size, dragging and dropping for the best position, and stylish fonts to enhance the appearance. A lot was learned from this assignment in relation to using Adobe Illustrator, and it was a great experience for exploring the creative side of my mind..

title: Suzuki Ignis Advertisement
description: Instagram advertisement created in the class 'GRDE 129: Introduction to Graphic Design', presenting the Suzuki Ignis by utilizing the software Adobe Illustrator and tools such as scaling, cropping for getting the best-suited image size, dragging and dropping for the best position, and stylish fonts to enhance the appearance. A lot was learned from this assignment in relation to using Adobe Illustrator, and it was a great experience for exploring the creative side of my mind.

title: Haagen-Dazs Indesign Assignment
description: Designed in the class 'GRDE 129: Introduction to Graphic Design' using Adobe InDesign, with innovative tools such as scaling for proper sizing of images, sophisticated fonts for attractivity, and color droppers for applying blending colors to fonts to complement the images, and demonstrating my creativity. A lot was learned from this course when it comes to designing and expressing the creative mind.

title: Mythic Runner(Final Project)
description: An innovative advertisement was created to showcase one of the few video games that I created for my final project in the class 'GRDE-129:Introduction to Graphic Design' using the software 'Adobe InDesign.'

title: Digital Security Ethics, and Privacy
description: Group assignment completed in the class 'ITEC-120: Introduction to Computer Hardware.' Discussing security issues faced through the internet, such as malware and cyber-attacks, and how easily an individual can be targeted. Points were also presented for implementation on how to solve these issues, such as setting a strong password, using biometric scans, multi-factor authentication, and more. Internet security can be a serious issue, and doing this assignment was a great lesson for an IT user.

title: History Of Telecommunication
description: The final project was accomplished in the class 'ITEC-120: Introduction to Computer Hardware,' beginning by defining telecommunication as the transmission of signals for communication over a distance. A discussion of the evolution of telecommunication over the years was also included, as were some examples of telecommunication with advantages such as saving time and gasoline rather than traveling from one point to another to communicate. While there are in fact a lot of advantages, some may still find it difficult to understand or unable to access it in rural areas. This project taught a valuable lesson on the reasons for telecommunications use and the benefits of it to society.

title: History of Windows
description: Final Project for the class 'ITEC-122: Introduction to Operating Systems' in relation to the history of Windows, starting from Windows 1.0, released in 1985, until Windows 11, released in 2021. Windows device management, including the I/O manager, device driver, and more, were mentioned. Additionally, Windows process management, including process creation and scheduling, priority levels, and more, as well as memory management containing the kernel, memory protection and pools, and a lot more, were also discussed within the project. During the completion of this project, I was able to learn a lot and gain in-depth knowledge of the Windows operating systems.

title: Methods in JAVA
description: Program created in the class 'ITEC-133: Introduction to Programming,' using different methods, including a method for calculating the hypotenuse of specific numbers by taking user input for height and width and using math functions for calculation; a second method for getting menu options based on user input and using a switch statement for each input; and a third method for calculating the sum of squared numbers between 0 and the input given by the user. Math functions were used to find the square of numbers along with the sum. and finally, a palindrome checker that used a for loop to iterate through a word and determine if it was a palindrome or not; the program would output a statement instructing whether it was a palindrome or not.

title: GPA calculator using JAVA
description: Final project to conclude the class 'ITEC-133: Introduction to Programming,' Using Intelij, I was able to create a program that was capable of taking a student's full name and student ID, along with their current academic year and semester, and the total courses enrolled in for the semester. The program was capable of calculating the total GPA of the student based on the number of courses and credits per course. A switch statement was used in order to return the respective grade based on the GPA. This final project enabled a valuable lesson for my journey in programming by giving me in-depth knowledge of using a switch statement properly.

title: System vulnerability and Computer Crimes
description: Group assignment in the class 'ITEC-140: Commercial and Industrial Systems' discussing different issues that can possibly happen with systems in organizations, such as security issues, hardware failure and more.

title: Brain-Blitz: Galaxy
description: finalized in the class 'ITEC-229: Human Computer Interface,' with the objective of designing software for an intended purpose. I decided to design a game designated for children below the age of 18 to enhance learning with the use of a phone. Due to the fact that they are being introduced to it at a very young age, it becomes an addiction. The game featured various levels such as alphabet learning, counting, and basic math operations, concluding with a challenging equation level. I designed documentation and conducted a survey for parents with children under 18, enhancing my skills for creating user-friendly software in the future

title: The Dark Side of Online Gaming
description: Research paper on the dark side of online video games accomplished in the class 'LIBS-130: Fundamental Research Skills', with information based on the negative impact of online gaming towards children

title: The Negative Consequences of Social Media
description: Final assignment for the class 'WRIT-117: Fundamentals of Writing'completed with a group, developing a report on the negative consequences of indulging in social media, including the risk of it becoming an addiction, a substitute for physical socializing, and a target for cyber-bullying in many states. The completion of this assignment and class taught me a lot about writing in an academic and professional manner, using reliable sources.roper citations, clear and concise language

title: Asteroid Evasion Project Management
description: Final Project for the class 'ITEC-115: Introduction to Project Management', accomplished within a group of five with the objective of planning a project that resulted in a video game called Asteroid Evasion featuring a space-themed adventure in both 2D and 3D. The game consisted of many features, as reported throughout the document. The project was split into sections so that each team member was able to participate. Different sections of the portfolio include business value, brand identity and value, technological differentiation, competitive environment, and more.

title: Hybrid SD-WAN topology
description: Final Project for the class 'ITEC-250: Computer Network and Architecture Protocol', concluded within a group of five with the intention of designing a topology for a network. My group implemented a hybrid software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN hybrid topology), which can be defined in summary as a technology that uses a software-based approach to manage and optimize wide area networks (WANs) more effectively than traditional hardware-centric ones. The SD-WAN design combined hubs and spokes and a partial mesh topology.

title: Java Bank Application
description: final Project finalized in the class 'ITEC-235: Object Oriented Programming,' with the objective of developing a bank application, with multiple features and functions, including options to open a checkings account, savings account and loan account. Users were able to enter customer information, Account Information, and Operations to perform.

title: 24 Hour Supermarket Business Plan
description: Final project for the class 'ENTP-210: Fundamentals of Entrepreneurship,' featuring team collaboration on conceptualizing and formulating a simple but detailed business plan for a 24-hour supermarket, with marketing strategies including pricing, promotions, and more, along with financial projections, determining the funding requirements, and presenting the profits or loss over a one-year period. It also includes an operational plan, industry analysis, and more.

title: System Analsysis on Supermarket
description: Final project for the class 'ITEC 225: System Analysis,' performing a system analysis for a supermarket and recommending upgrades to improve efficiency and customer satisfaction. The analysis included current system evaluation, requirements gathering, and proposed solutions for inventory management, point of sale systems, and customer relationship management.

title: Database Design for Atlas Gym
description: Final project for the class ITEC 270: Database Design I, completed as a team, focused on designing and implementing a relational database for Atlas Gym, a growing fitness center facing challenges with manual data management. The project involved analyzing business requirements, defining structural and procedural rules, creating conceptual, logical, and physical models, and normalizing tables to third normal form. Key entities included members, memberships, payments, classes, instructors, training sessions, and health records. The solution featured optimized queries for reporting, forms for staff interaction, and a switchboard for navigation, ensuring efficient membership tracking, scheduling, and secure health data management.

title: Opening a Chipotle Franchise in Trinidad and Tobago
description: Final project for the class MGMT 125: Principles Of Management, with the focus of opening a Chipotle franchise in Trinidad and Tobago, and maintaining the management of the franchise. With topics including planning, organizing, leading, and controlling, along with SWOT analysis, Human Resource Management Considerations, and more, to ensure the successful management of the franchise in a new market.
